definitions.definition: Having a value of; proper to be exchanged for.
examples: How much / What is your house worth ? - Now it's worth half what I paid for it. So it'd sure would be worth while to repair before putting it for sale.
Cleanliness is a virtue worth more than others.
A painting once thought to be worth thousands that is actually not worth much.
Is it well worth visiting your hometown? -Nah, Leicester is not worth it at all.
He found going to the Edinburgh Castle was worth it.
I think you’ll find my proposal worth your attention.
I didn't think it worth complaining about his friendship not being worth having.

definitions.definition: Making a fair equivalent of, repaying or compensating .
examples: This job is hardly worth the effort.

main_definition: Having a value of; proper to be exchanged for.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , except in Scots ) Valuable , worthwhile .
Making a fair equivalent of, repaying or compensating .
